result.execSummary:
The defendant Donyell Kenn Claybon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA Sample. Pay mandatory DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation. any cash bail to apply. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment subject to tax intercept and any applicable collection procedures. Court WAIVED mandatory and non-mandatory (except for DNA and DV surcharge) court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Restitution set at ZERO.
- Obtain/maintain full-time employment/schooling/treatment or combination of all.

- NO CONTACT with F.D., M.D. and C.S.
- NO CONTACT with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

- Mental Health Evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
- Complete a Cognitive Behavioral Intervention Program.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens. No controlled substance without a valid prescription.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donyell Kenn Claybon

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed, Received and Filed, Notice of Completion

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION

-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens. No controlled substance without a valid prescription. 
-Complete a Cognitive Behavioral  Intervention Program. 
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with F.D., M.D. and C.S.
-Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling/treatment or combination of all.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay MANDATORY DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, any cash bail to apply. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment subject to tax intercept and any applicable collection procedures. 
-Court WAIVED MANDATORY and NON MANDATORY (except for DNA and DV surcharge) court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Defendant Donyell Kenn Claybon in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  State moves to revoke. Defense and Defendant CONCEDED that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION. The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.
Received and Filed, Letter from victim
Received and Filed, Email from victim

HELD OFF THE RECORD. Due to court congestion case not called on the record. parties select a Revocation and Sentencing date. Case adjourned for Revocation and Sentencing on 6/6/2022 at 2:00 in branch 21.

Defendant Donyell Kenn Claybon in court with attorney Amanda Parent on behalf of Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donyell Kenn Claybon appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defendant has a new case. State moves to revoke. Court takes the State's Motion under advisement. Case adjourned for Status Conference in branch 21. 
  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
  Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed, DPA Discharge Summary 04.11.22

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms or application for a CCW license. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Oral, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with FD., MD., AND CS.   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Donyell Kenn Claybon in court with attorney Dawn Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appear via zoom.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Initial Appearance. Court finds defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right to have an in person hearing and proceeds remotely.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Review hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Received and Filed, Addendum to Plea form
Received and Filed, Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Plea Advisement Form
